title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 63.5 - Importation of feeder swine
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1 ยง 63.5 - Importation of feeder swine

State Regulations

Feeder swine to be eligible for importation into New York

State must meet the following requirements: (a) Be accompanied by an approved health
certificate and be individually identified. (b) For pseudorabies: (1)
originate from a pseudorabies class IV or
free state; or
(2)
originate from a
pseudorabies qualified negative herd; or
(3)
originate from a pseudorabies monitored
herd; or
(4)
be individually tested
and found negative for pseudorabies within 30 days prior to shipment. Such swine shall be held separate and apart from all
breeding swine. Proof of slaughter shall be provided by the owner upon
request. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 1
ยง
63.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
